channel.description: Okta Automation Tools Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Structure type: Navigation Content type: Autogenerated Index An autogenerated index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs.

item.title: Okta Workflows
item.description: Okta Workflows Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: A developers intorduction to Okta Workflows, what they are for, what problems it solves and how developers write code against it (if at all). Are there any connections with SCIM and LCM applications and therefore the OIN for example? Also, make sure to compare and contrast with Connector Buidler and Hooks.

item.title: Workflow Connector Builder
item.description: Workflow Connector Builder Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: A brief introduction to Workflows Connector Builder that distinguishes it from Okta Workflows the Platform and what hooks are for. Note that WCB can create flows that can also be submitted to OIN. Then redirect to the help doc area. https://help.okta.com/wf/en-us/content/topics/workflows/connector-builder/connector-builder.htm?cshid=ext-connector-builder Links to original docs: + https://help.okta.com/wf/en-us/content/topics/workflows/connector-builder/connector-builder.htm?cshid=ext-connector-builder Why is this here?

item.title: Hooks
item.description: Inline and Event Hooks Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: An overview of event and inline hooks, what they are, and some basic use cases. Establisht eh difference between hooks and the Workflows platform, and then provide link to the more detailed “How to Implement a hook section” (ID: 660) Links to original docs: - Event hooks: https://developer.
